title: KAS-XMSS: Sovereign Post-Quantum Signature Suite
description:
KAS-XMSS is a deterministic, hash-based post-quantum digital signature framework developed by the Kapodistrian Academy of Science. Built upon the XMSS standard (RFC 8391), KAS-XMSS provides sovereign, reproducible signature generation and verification for post-quantum use cases. It supports applications in national research infrastructure, secure long-term archives, and hybrid integration with QD-RSA.

Includes: Python and C reference implementations, test vectors, whitepaper, and automated entropy tools.

🛡️ Signature Layer Independence: No reliance on NIST or external authorities. Fully auditable entropy generation and deterministic reproducibility ensure cryptographic sovereignty.
